intro: Odontarrhena gymnopoda, commonly known as the naked-stemmed sedge, is a perennial herb native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its stems are usually unbranched and cylindrical, with narrow, grass-like leaves. The flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
